isis.stitle: SPICER 14 INCH (350 MM) SOLO CLUTCH - OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The clutch is used to transfer engine power from the flywheel to the transmission. When clutch engagement is initiated, the transmission input shaft may be stationary, as when the vehicle is at a standstill, or rotating, as in upshifting or downshifting. When full engagement is achieved, the flywheel and transmission input shaft will rotate at the same speed.

To perform this function, the clutch is equipped with a disc(s) which has friction surfaces called facings. When the clutch pedal in the cab is depressed, the pressure is moved away from the flywheel freeing the disc(s) from contact with the flywheel friction surface.
